CHAPTER 711
Loudspeakers and Sound Devices
 
711.01   Permit required.
711.02   Application and issuance.
711.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Vehicle horns, sirens etc. - see TRAF.
337.19, Ch.
338
Disorderly conduct - see GEN. OFF.
509.03
 
711.01 PERMIT REQUIRED.
   No person shall use any loudspeaker, drum or other instrument or device for
the purpose of attracting attention by the creation of noise to any
performance, show or sale or display of any merchandise without first obtaining
a permit therefor from the Manager or his designee.
(Ord. 438. Passed 7-7-66.)
 
711.02 APPLICATION AND ISSUANCE.
   Written application for the permit required in Section
711.01 shall be made stating the time and purpose of use of any such instrument
or device. The Manager or his designee may issue such permit only when he is
satisfied that the issuance will not result in an unreasonable amount of noise
to the detriment of the peace, health or comfort of any individual or the
public.
(Ord. 438. Passed 7-7-66.)
 
711.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be fined not more than
one hundred dollars ($100.00). Each day's continued violation shall constitute
a separate offense.
 
 
 
CHAPTER 717
Parking Lots
 
   EDITOR'S NOTE: Former Chapter
717 has been relocated to Chapter
1155 of the Codified Ordinances.
 
 
 
CHAPTER 723
Canvassers and Solicitors
 
723.01   Definitions.
723.02   Certificate of registration and identification card required; tax
form.
723.03   Application for certificate of registration.
723.04   Issuance of certificate; duration.
723.05   Display of registration certificate and identification card; return.
723.06   Registry of residences.
723.07   Notice prohibiting canvassing or solicitation.
723.08   Trespassing in violation of posted notice or registration.
723.09   Other restrictions.
723.10   Revocation of certificate.
723.11   Penalty.
 
723.01 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter certain terms are defined as follows:
   (a)   "Canvassing" or "soliciting", unless expressly provided for otherwise,
means traveling from residence to residence within the City without having a
previous appointment for the purpose of exposing or offering for inspection or
sale, goods, wares, merchandise, foodstuffs or any other property, tangible or
intangible, of any nature whatsoever; or services; or for the purpose of taking
or attempting to take orders for the purchase of goods, wares, merchandise,
foodstuffs or other property, tangible or intangible, of any nature whatsoever,
for future delivery, or services to be furnished or performed in the future.
"Canvassing" or "soliciting" also means the soliciting of funds or other
property for charitable or other purposes anywhere within the City.
   (b)   Notwithstanding the foregoing, the following individuals are exempt
from the provisions of this ordinance and are excluded from the above
definition:
      (1)   Newspaper carriers along their regular delivery routes.
      (2)   An individual acting on behalf of a local organization which would
meet the qualifications for tax exemption as a religious, charitable or
benevolent institution under the current federal Internal Revenue Service law
or rules or an amendments thereto in the future. "Local" means having it
principal place of business or having an active chapter, affiliate, branch or
other division of larger organization in the Chardon Local School District.
   (c)   "Canvasser" or "solicitor" means any person who engages in canvassing
or soliciting.
      (Ord. 1700. Passed 10-10-96.)
 
723.02 CERTIFICATE OF REGISTRATION AND IDENTIFICATION CARD REQUIRED; TAX FORM.
   (a)   No person (except those exempt under §
723.01(b)) shall canvass or solicit in the City without first registering with
the City Manager or the Manager's designate. While engaged in said activities,
the canvasser or solicitor shall hold a current, valid, non-revoked
registration and identification card issued by the City, be in possession of
the registration and present the registration and identification card and wear
the identification card conspicuously at all times while canvassing or
soliciting.
 
   (b)   Each applicant for a certificate of registration shall, not less than
five nor more than 15 days prior to the commencement of canvassing or
soliciting, furnish the City Manager with the following information on forms
provided by the City:
      (1)   Name, age and physical description of applicant;
      (2)   Complete permanent and local addresses of applicant, Social
Security number and the tax identification number of the applicant's employer;
      (3)   Name and address of the person, firm, corporation organization or
association for whom the applicant will canvass or solicit and all other
persons, firms, corporations, organizations, or associations for whom the
applicant has canvassed or solicited during the past three years;
      (4)   A description of the nature of the business and the goods, services
or wares sold, sufficient to identify the subject matter of the canvassing or
soliciting in which the applicant shall engage;
      (5)   Other municipalities in which the applicant has canvassed or
solicited during the past twelve months;
      (6)   Whether the applicant has complied with the requirements of R.C.
Chapter 1716 pertaining to charitable solicitations (if applicable).
      (7)   Whether the applicant has ever had a similar license or permit
denied or revoked including the time and place of such denial or revocation;
      (8)   Whether the applicant has ever been convicted of a felony or a
misdemeanor involving moral turpitude, sex offense, drug offense or assault and
the date, place and description of each conviction;
      (9)   The proposed dates and times of the canvassing or solicitations;
      (10)   The make, model, year, color and license plate number of the
automobile(s) used by the applicant while canvassing or soliciting within the
City; and the number of applicant's driver's license and state of issuance;
      (11)   Two photographs of the applicant of appropriate size
(approximately 2" x 2"), one of which shall be attached at all times to the
certificate and the other for the records of the Chardon Police Department; and
      (12)   Submission to fingerprinting, if requested by the Chardon Police
Department, for good cause shown for local police files and for the purpose of
determining the criminal record, if any, of the applicant.
      (13)   A City Income Tax Registration Form shall also be completed upon
request.
         (Ord. 1700. Passed 10-10-96.)
 
723.03 APPLICATION FOR CERTIFICATE OF REGISTRATION.
   Applications for certificate of registration shall be obtained from the
office of the City Manager.
(Ord. 1700. Passed 10-10-96.)
 
723.04 ISSUANCE OF CERTIFICATE; DURATION.
   (a)   Issuance of Certificate.
      (1)   Not more than five days after completion of the application form
provided in §
723.03, the City Manager or the Manager's designate shall issue a certificate
of registration to each applicant upon payment of a fee of $50.00, unless it is
determined by the City Manager or the Manager's designate that:
         A.   The applicant has misrepresented his or her identity or intention
or made a false, misleading or deceptive statement in completing the
application for certificate of registration under §
723.03 or in providing the information required under §
723.02.
         B.   The applicant has been convicted of a felony or a misdemeanor
involving moral turpitude, force or violence, sex offense or a drug offense
within the period of five years preceding the date of application.
         C.   The applicant or the entity which the applicant represents is not
current in payments or other obligations required by Chapter
151 of the Codified Ordinances, Income Tax.
      (2)   No fee shall be required for those persons excluded herein under §
723.01(b), or those persons acting on behalf of a charitable, religious or
educational organization as defined in R.C. § 2915.01(H),(I) or (J).
 
   (b)   No assignment or transfer. The certificate of registration issued
hereunder shall not be transferred, assigned or used by any person other than
the person to whom it is issued.
 
   (c)   Duration. The certificate of registration issued hereunder shall be
valid for a period of one year.
(Ord. 1700. Passed 10-10-96.)
 
723.05 DISPLAY OF REGISTRATION CERTIFICATE AND IDENTIFICATION CARD; RETURN.
   Each registrant shall carry the registration certificate and identification
card at all times while canvassing or soliciting in the City and shall exhibit
it to any resident or municipal official upon request. When the registration
period expires, the certificate of registration and identification card shall
be returned to the City Manager.
(Ord. 1700. Passed 10-10-96.)
 
723.06 REGISTRY OF RESIDENCES.
   (a)   The City Manager or the Manager's designate shall maintain a registry
of residences listing the street addresses of residents who do not allow
uninvited solicitation for business purposes by canvassers and solicitors. Any
City resident who requests that his or her address be included in the registry
shall do so by completing a form provided by the City Manager stating the name
and address of residents and the intention to not allow uninvited solicitation
for business purposes by canvassers or solicitors.
 
   (b)   A copy of the registry shall be provided annually to each registrant
with the certificate of registration and as part of the annual fee. The
registrant shall be responsible for obtaining periodic registry supplements
from the City Manager.
(Ord. 1700. Passed 10-10-96.)
 
723.07 NOTICE PROHIBITING CANVASSING OR SOLICITATION.
   Notice by the owner(s) or occupant(s) of any residence of the intention to
refuse to receive any uninvited canvassers or solicitors shall be given by
displaying notice at or near the entrance to the residence which reads "No
Canvassers, Solicitors or Peddlers Allowed", "No Solicitors Invited", "No
Soliciting", or other words which indicate the intention of the owner(s) or
occupant(s) to prohibit canvassers and solicitors on the premises.
(Ord. 1700. Passed 10-10-96.)
 
723.08 TRESPASSING IN VIOLATION OF POSTED NOTICE OR REGISTRATION.
   (a)   No canvasser or solicitor shall knock at the door ring the bell of any
house, apartment, condominium or other dwelling unit in the City upon which is
displayed near the entrance a notice prohibiting canvassing and soliciting,
unless such canvasser or solicitor is, or has been, invited on the premises of
the owner or occupant.
 
   (b)   No canvasser or solicitor shall knock on the door, ring the bell or
otherwise call upon any home, apartment, condominium or other dwelling unit in
the City, if the owner(s) or occupant(s) of said residence have registered with
the City Manager requesting that no canvassers or solicitors enter upon the
premises, unless such canvasser or solicitor is, or has been invited on the
premises of the owner(s) or occupant(s).
(Ord. 1700. Passed 10-10-96.)
 
723.09 OTHER RESTRICTIONS.
   Every canvasser or solicitor who is issued a certificate of registration
shall be governed by the following rules and regulations:
   (a)   No person shall canvass or solicit except between the hours of 9:00
a.m. and 9:00 p.m. Monday through Saturday. In addition, no person shall
canvass or solicit on Sunday or on any legal holiday as defined in R.C. § 1.14.
   (b)   No canvasser or solicitor shall enter or attempt to enter a house,
apartment, condominium or other dwelling unit of any resident of the City
without an express invitation from the occupant.
   (c)   No canvasser or solicitor shall engage in or transact any type of
business activity or solicitation other than specified in the certificate of
registration.
      (Ord. 1700. Passed 10-10-96.)
 
723.10 REVOCATION OF CERTIFICATE.
   A certificate of registration issued under this chapter shall be revoked by
the City Manager or the Manager's designate for any of the following causes:
   (a)   The registrant provided false, misleading or deceptive information in
completing the application set forth in §
723.03, or has violated any provision of this chapter.
   (b)   The registrant or the entity the registrant represents fails to make
all current payments and comply with other obligations of Chapter
151, Codified Ordinances, Income Tax.
   Written notice shall be given to the registrant in person or by certified
mail immediately upon such revocation.
(Ord. 1700. Passed 10-10-96.)
 
723.11 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a misdemeanor of
the third degree.
(Ord. 1700. Passed 10-10-96.)
 
 
 
CHAPTER 729
Taxicab Control
 
729.01   Definitions.
729.02   Insurance requirement.
729.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Manager's powers and duties - see CHTR. §
5.02 
Power to regulate - see R.C. §§ 715.22, 715.66
Power to establish stands and fix rates - see R.C. § 715.25
Taxicab stands - see TRAF.
351.10
 
729.01 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter, certain terms are defined as follows:
   (a)   "Street" means and includes any public street, alley and public way
within the corporate limits of the City.
   (b)   "Taxicab" means and includes any motor driven vehicle engaged in the
business of carrying passengers for hire or fare or offered for hire or fare to
the public for transportation, operating within the municipality, except motor
buses operated on regular schedules and over regularly established routes.
   (c)   "Taxicab driver" means any person who drives or operates a taxicab.
   (d)   "Taxicab operator" means and includes every corporation, company,
association, joint stock association, person, firm or co-partnership, their
licensees, trustees, receivers or trustees appointed by any court whatsoever,
owning, controlling, operating, maintaining or managing one or more taxicabs
within the City.
      (Ord. 1230. Passed 10-12-89.)
 
729.02 INSURANCE REQUIREMENT.
   (a) No person who owns or operates a taxicab on the streets of the City
shall operate such taxicab without maintaining a liability policy in the amount
of five hundred thousand dollars ($500,000) for each person, one million
dollars ($1,000,000) aggregate for each person for personal injury and one
hundred thousand dollars ($100,000) property damage coverage.
 
   (b)   Such owner or operator shall file with the City Manager a copy of such
insurance policy prior to operating upon the streets of the City.
(Ord. 1230. Passed 10-12-89.)
 
729.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter shall be fined not less than
ten dollars ($10.00) nor more than one hundred dollars ($100.00). Each day of
operation without insurance upon the streets of the City shall constitute a
separate offense.
(Ord. 1230. Passed 10-12-89.)
